bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Laura Armistead Carter, November 30, 1926

div1.p: Read informs Carter that the International Health Board entered a statement about Henry Rose Carter's life and work into their records as a tribute to his contributions to public health.

November 30, 1926.
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
At the meeting of the International Health Board held
on November 5, 1925, formal announcement was made of the death
Dr. Henry Rose Carter on September 14, 1925, and a special com-
mittee, consisting of Dr. William H. Welch, Dr. David L. Edsall,
and Dr. Simon Flexner, was appointed to draft a suitable resolu-
tion for presentation to the Board at the meeting on May 25, 1926.
Owing to illness, Dr. Welch was not able to attend the May meet-
ing, and the statement was presented by him at the next meeting
of the Board on November 4, 1926. It was resolved that the
statement be adopted by a rising vote and entered in the perma-
nent records of the International Health Board as a tribute to
Dr. Carter, and that a copy be sent to you.
